snippet.title: Fighting Vipers - Sega Saturn - Intro & Pepsiman secret character longplay [1080p 60fps]
snippet.description:
Full playthrough / longplay / walkthrough / gameplay / Guide trueplay as the Japanese only secret character Pepsiman. Who, as you can imagine is one giant walking Pepsi cola advert, while the character was only in the Saturn port of the original game and is not present in the Model 2 arcade version. He plays like Dural from Virtua Fighter with a mix of moves from other characters, he was reskinned and renamed as Kuhn for Fighting Vipers 2.

Unlocking Pepsiman (ペプシマン) is really easy get to Picky, stage 3 in arcade mode then allow him to defeat you with a double perfect at which point Pepsiman will then challenge you.

While graphically a step down from Virtua Fighter 2 on Saturn, the game is able to run at 60fps smoothly with only the old bit of slowdown. The game also manages to include 3D background walls and dynamic lighting on certain stages. While the plane taking off in Tokio stage is missing in Fighting Vipers, AM2 where able to improve the game engine by the time they did Fighters Megamix on Saturn and were able to add it back in. Pepsiman isn't the only extra pulled from from western release Candy / Honey's extra costumes also got cut.

This is a supporting video for our region change blog feature: http://randomisedgaming.tumblr.com/post/163253020547/sega-saturn-games-with-major-region-and-version

Also known as: ファイティングバイパーズ (Japan)

Release: 1996
Developer: AM2
Publisher: Sega / セガ
Format: Sega Saturn (SS) / セガサターン 

Fighting Vipers is also available on Xbox 360, Xbox One, PlayStation 3 and PlayStation 2. However these are all ports of the arcade game and lack most of the extras included in the Saturn version. 

Randomised Gaming blog: http://randomisedgaming.tumblr.com  
Twitter: https://twitter.com/rdmdgaming 

All footage in this video is captured directly from the Sega Saturn console, via an Elgato Game Capture HD60 Pro using a RGB Scart to HDMI upscaler.

#FightingVipers #SEGASaturn #AM2
